meanings.definition: Present participle of bare: uncover or expose
meanings.sent1: The detective was baring the truth about the crime.
meanings.sent2: She was baring her soul to her best friend.
meanings.sent3: The magician was baring the hidden card with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: The storm was baring the vulnerability of the old house.
meanings.sent5: The documentary was baring the harsh reality of life in the city.

meanings.definition: Present participle of bear: carry or support
meanings.sent1: The strong man was baring the weight of the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: The mother bear was baring her cubs to safety.
meanings.sent3: The superhero was baring the burden of protecting the city.
meanings.sent4: The tree was baring the weight of the snow on its branches.
meanings.sent5: The backpack was baring the school supplies for the student.

meanings.definition: Present participle of bar: prevent or forbid access
meanings.sent1: The locked gate was baring entry to the garden.
meanings.sent2: The security guard was baring access to the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: The closed sign was baring customers from entering the store.
meanings.sent4: The barrier was baring passage through the road.
meanings.sent5: The password was baring unauthorized users from the system.
